cdn.description: CDN URLs. Returns an Object with the CDNs available and URLs

loginPath.description: Returns the address of the Login page

services.description: Services URLs. Returns an Object with the services available and URLs

return.description: HTML5 elements created with boolean value.

params.name: Optional.
params.description: List of specific objects to create (e.g.: Sushi.HTML5.shiv("canvas, time, aside") );

shiv.description:
Enable HTML5 Elements inside IE (8 and before)
script by Remy Sharp http://remysharp.com/2009/01/07/html5-enabling-script/

return.description: string without accented characters in lower case

replaceAccents.description:
Converts every accented letter in a string with its non-accented equivalent.
Currently WIP, trying to squeeze this function as much as possible. 
(≈3ms per string, with 2 calls ≈ 1.5ms per call)

Sushi.utils.name: Sushi.utils

return.description: Whether argument is an array or not
Whether argument is a RegExp or not

isRegExp.description: Checks if an object is a Regular Expression

return.description: Whether variable is a date

isDate.description: Checks whether a given variable is a date

return.description: Whether value is a number or not.

isString.description: Detects wether a value is a string

return.description: Array containing the object's key names.

keys.description:
Retrieve the names of an object's properties.
Defaults to ECMAScript 5's native Object.keys. Lifted from Underscore JS.

return.description: Whether argument is NaN or not

isNaN.description:
Checks if an object is NaN
NaN happens to be the only object in Javascript that is not equal to itself.

return.description: Whether argument is equal to null or not

isNull.description: Checks if an object's value is equal to null

return.description: Array containing the progression.

params.name: start
params.description: Value to start progression from. Defaults to 0

params.name: step
params.description: Value to increment progression by. Defaults to 1

range.description:
Generate an integer Array containing an arithmetic progression.
A port of the native Python range(). Lifted from Underscore JS.
See http://docs.python.org/library/functions.html#range for more info.

return.description: Whether argument is empty or not

isEmpty.description: Checks if an object is empty

return.description: Unique ID

params.name: prefix
params.description: Optional prefix to prepend to the unique ID

uniqueId.description: Generates a unique integer ID (within the client session)

return.description: Whether objects are equal or not

isEqual.description: Performs a deep comparison to check if two objects are equal.

return.description: Whether argument is a DOM node or not

isElement.description: Checks if an object is a DOM node

return.description: Whether argument is a function or not

isFunction.description: Checks if an object is a function

return.description: Whether value is a number or not.

isNumber.description: Detects whether a value is a number

return.description: Whether argument is equal to undefined or not

isUndefined.description: Checks if an object is equal to undefined

return.description: Value passed in to the function
Whether variable is an arguments object

isArguments.description: Checks whether a given variable is an arguments object

Sushi.utils.description: General purpose utility functions for the Sushi JS framework

log.description: Logs comma-separated arguments to the console using console.log()

_supports.description: Returns the debugging methods the environment supports

return.description: Returns false, if it's not possible to force the Garbage Collector, otherwise nothing is returned.

garbageCollect.description: Forces IE to run its garbage Collector

warn.description: Logs comma-separated arguments to the console using console.warn()

error.description: Logs comma-separated arguments to the console using console.error()

logHistory.description: Prints the whole cached debug history to the console

dir.description: Logs comma-separated arguments to the console using console.dir()

return.description: Old variable in array format

params.name: iterable
params.description: Variable to convert to an array

toArray.description: Safely convert anything iterable into a real, live array.

return.description: Reduced Array

params.name: Function
params.description: to execute on each value in the array.

params.name: memo
params.description: Object to use as the first argument to the first call of the callback.

reduceRight.description:
Reduce builds up a single result from a list of values (from right-to-left). 
Delegates to ECMAScript 5's native reduceRight if available.

return.description: True if an object matches the truth test.

params.name: iterator
params.description: Function that produces an element of the new Array from an element of the current one.

params.name: context
params.description: Object to use as "this" when executing iterator

some.description:
Determine if at least one element in the object matches a truth test.
Delegates to ECMAScript 5's native some if available.

return.description: True if needle is present.

params.name: heystack
params.description: Object or Array to search in.

contains.description: Determine if a given value is included in the array or object using ===.

return.description: Reduced Array

params.name: iterator
params.description: Function to execute on each value in the array.

params.name: memo
params.description: Object to use as the first argument to the first call of the callback.

reduce.description:
Reduce builds up a single result from a list of values 
from left-to-right.
Delegates to ECMAScript 5's native reduce if available.

return.description: Property in object

pluck.description: Convenience method for Sushi.utils.map to get a property from an object.

return.description: Filtered Array

params.name: iterator
params.description: Function to execute on each value in the array.

params.name: memo
params.description: Object to use as the first argument to the first call of the callback.

filter.description:
Return all the elements that pass a truth test.
Delegates to ECMAScript 5's native filter if available.

return.description: Reduced Array

params.name: iterator
params.description: Function that produces an element of the new Array from an element of the current one.

params.name: context
params.description: Object to use as "this" when executing iterator

map.description:
Creates a new array with the results of calling a provided function 
on every element in this array.
Delegates to ECMAScript 5's native map if available.

params.name: iterator
params.description: Function to callback for each element

params.name: context
params.description: Object to use as "this" when executing iterator

each.description:
Cornerstone each (forEach) implementation.
Handles objects implementing forEach, arrays, and raw objects. 
Delegates to ECMAScript 5's native forEach if available.
Based on the Underscore JS implementation.

return.description: Well formatted JS literal

parse.description: Converts a JSON-formatted string into a Javascript literal object

return.description: Well formatted JSON string

stringify.description: Converts a Javascript literal object into a well formatted JSON string

return.description: Namespaced object

namespace.description: A utility that non-destructively defines namespaces

return.description: Sushi Object

params.name: Mandatory.
params.description: New Namespace where Sushi is going to live

params.name: Optional.
params.description: New Sugar syntax to shorthand the Sushi's namespace

noConflict.description:
noConflict utility. If by some reason, the Sushi's namespace must be used by some other object,
this function will allow to remap the Sushi's namespace to another namespace

return.description: Extended object

Sushi.base.name: Sushi.base
Sushi.base.description:
Sushi JS
Copyright (C) 2011 Bruno Abrantes
MIT Licensed

return.description: A handle which can be used to unsubscribe this particular subscription

params.name: callback
params.description:
The handler event. Anytime something is Sushi.events.publish'ed on a 
subscribed channel, the callback will be called with the
published array as ordered arguments.

params.name: handle
params.description: The return value from a Sushi.events.subscribe call

params.name: args
params.description:
The data to publish. Each array item is converted into an ordered
arguments on the subscribed functions.
